The world's oldest and largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization also just celebrated a birthday of sorts. The Bitcoin network has now processed more than 1 billion transactions.
Bitcoin daily transactions spiked to an all-time high this time last year
column2: when the BRC-20 standard and ordinals soared in popularity—but not without creating a bit of controversy. A vocal group of developers at the time said that BRC-20 tokens and ordinals should be blocked on the network.

column1: But now a newcomer
column2: Runes
column3: has become the main driver behind growing daily transactions. Just yesterday
column4: the Bitcoin network saw 304
column9: 000 of Ordinals and BRC-20 transactions combined
column10: according to a Dune dashboard. That means Runes made up roughly 60% of all transactions on the network yesterday.

column1: Runes is a protocol built on top of Bitcoin. It's been described as a project that picks up where BRC-20 tokens
column2: which effectively introduced NFT-like assets to the network. Runes is an attempt to make the process of creating fungible tokens on Bitcoin more efficient and has ushered in a new era of shitcoins for the crypto OG.

An old #Bitcoin wallet from 2011 just moved $44 Million worth of BTC. The owner of the wallet hodled all the way from $2 to $65000. What a legend! pic.twitter.com/tqKt6hxcWj — Vivek⚡️ (@Vivek4real_) May 6

column2: a 13-year-old wallet that's held 687 Bitcoin since it was trading for $2 has just moved their stash. It was highlighted by Bitgrow founder Vivek Sen on Twitter earlier this morning.

column1: It's hard to say why an anonymous whale wallet that was created more than a decade ago moved its funds
column2: but traders tend to take it as a heartening sign when someone who could have sold at any time held onto their BTC for so long.

Grayscale Bitcoin Trust's shares jump after first inflow since January;"CNA";"https://www.channelnewsasia.com/business/grayscale-bitcoin-trusts-shares-jump-after-first-inflow-january-4315966";"2024-05-06 13:43:22.373496";"Shares of Grayscale Bitcoin Trust jumped 5 per cent in premarket trading on Monday after the exchange-traded fund (ETF) that tracks the price of bitcoin saw...";"Shares of Grayscale Bitcoin Trust jumped 5 per cent in premarket trading on Monday after the exchange-traded fund (ETF) that tracks the price of bitcoin saw its first day of inflow since January.The move marks a major milestone for GBTC
column2: which has seen $17.46 billion in withdrawals since it converted from";"Shares of Grayscale Bitcoin Trust jumped 5 per cent in premarket trading on Monday after the exchange-traded fund (ETF) that tracks the price of bitcoin saw its first day of inflow since January.

column1: The move marks a major milestone for GBTC
column2: which has seen $17.46 billion in withdrawals since it converted from a trust to an easily tradable ETF in January
column3: due to the higher fees it charges compared with rivals.

column1: Some outflows were also tied to the wave of bankruptcies in the crypto industry
column2: as companies that collapsed in the last two years pulled money out of the fund to repay their creditors.

column1: GBTC saw inflows of $63 million on Friday
column2: according to investment management firm Farside Investors. It has $18.08 billion in assets under management (AUM)
column3: according to its website.

column1: But its position as the biggest spot bitcoin ETF by AUM has come under threat from BlackRock's iShares Bitcoin Trust
column2: which manages $16.91 billion
column3: according to its website.

column1: Grayscale said in March that it would seek approval from the Securities and Exchange Commission to spin off a portion of GBTC's assets into a new
column2: lower-fee Bitcoin Mini Trust. However
column3: the company has yet to determine the fees the Mini Trust will charge.

column1: Spot bitcoin ETFs offer investors exposure to bitcoin without the need to hold it directly. They were approved by the SEC in January after being rejected for a decade.";"Shares of Grayscale Bitcoin Trust jumped 5 per cent in premarket trading on Monday. The exchange-traded fund that tracks the price of bitcoin saw its first day of inflow since January. GBTC has seen $17.46 billion in withdrawals since it converted from a trust to an easily tradable ETF in January. The company has yet to determine the fees the Mini Trust will charge. Spot bitcoin ETFs offer investors exposure to bitcoin without the need to hold it directly."

column1: Story Highlights Analyst Rekt Capital sees a buying opportunity in Bitcoin's recent dip.

In the whirlwind of Bitcoin’s market ups and downs
column2: one voice stands out

column1: But wait. Let’s back up a little. Why the bullish prediction? Is this the right move for your portfolio? Only one way to find out. Dive in!

Getting to the heart of the matter

column3: and how long will it last? Drawing from historical data
column4: Rekt Capital predicts a peak around 518 to 546 days after the halving event
column5: suggesting we could see it around mid-September or mid-October.

column1: This timeline syncs with the traditional rhythm of Bitcoin’s market cycles
column2: guided by halving events. Following this beat

column5: with losses expected to stabilize around 24%.

column1: Rekt Capital suggests using prior all-time highs to predict the peak. They highlight that Bitcoin’s bull market top occurs 266-315 days after reaching all-time highs. This method provides a new perspective on Bitcoin’s trajectory
column2: especially given its current rapid cycle.

column1: In addition
column2: Rekt Capital examines Bitcoin’s history after breaking old highs
column3: showing a trend of spending longer before the bull market tops. These findings extend the peak range to 280-350 days beyond old all-time highs.

U.S. Bitcoin ETFs: ‘Good’ for crypto or not? Analyst weighs in;"AMBCrypto";"https://ambcrypto.com/u-s-bitcoin-etfs-good-for-crypto-or-not-analyst-weighs-in/";"2024-05-06 11:43:22.435334";"US Bitcoin ETF approvals only offered regulatory clarity to BTC as the rest of the crypto market battles with uncertainty from US regulators.";"US Bitcoin ETF approvals only offered regulatory clarity to BTC as the rest of the crypto market battles with uncertainty from US regulators.";"U.S. Bitcoin ETFs elicited mixed signals on the crypto regulatory front.
Apart from BTC
column2: most of the crypto projects faced regulatory uncertainty.

column1: The U.S. spot Bitcoin [BTC] ETF approval in January continues to elicit mixed feelings about whether it “legitimizes crypto.”
In a recent interview with Bitcoin Magazine
column2: Neel Maitra
column3: a former SEC crypto specialist
column4: said that the January approval was “grudging” and doesn’t look great for the market.

column1: Part of his speech stated
“Its (approval) was grudging
column2: and it was just for Bitcoin
column3: and it’s not good news for the crypto generally.”

column1: To support his arguments
column2: Maitra mentioned the SEC’s rejection of spot BTC ETFs in the past seven years before the courts forced its hand.

column1: Additionally
column2: the agency emphasized that the approval was limited to BTC and shouldn’t be read as a general crypto approval.

column1: Divergent views on Bitcoin ETF impact
However
column2: Franklin Bi
column3: a general partner at Pantera Capital
column4: had a contrarian take. In an interview with “The Block
column5: ” the exec claimed that the U.S. spot BTC ETFs approval “validated crypto.”

column1: He further commented
“The approval has really shown people that directionally speaking
column2: regulation is still moving in a positive direction for digital assets.”

column1: The executive added that the approval also convinced many institutional investors that crypto is a long-term technology trend worth exploring.
True to Bi’s word
column2: U.S. spot BTC ETFs have seen massive interest from institutional players.

column1: For instance
column2: the leading world asset manager
column3: BlackRock
column4: had an impressive BTC ETF debut and is eyeing the tokenization of real-world assets on the blockchain.

column1: However
column2: regulatory heat in the industry still exists. Despite the approvals
column3: the SEC has filed lawsuits against Uniswap [UNI] and Consensys’ MetaMask.

column1: Additionally
column2: the agency has not clearly stated whether Ethereum [ETH] is not a security. This prompted Consensys to sue the SEC and seek clarity from the courts on the status of ETH.

column1: In a separate development
column2: a new class action lawsuit against Coinbase claims that the exchange misled investors into buying “securities” like Solana [SOL]
column3: Near [NEAR]
column4: and UNI

column1: That said
column2: BTC had regulatory clarity after the January ETF approvals. However
column3: several crypto projects and tokens like ETH face regulatory uncertainty.
